Quotes: I want it said of me by those who knew me best, that I always plucked a thistle and planted a flower where I thought a flower would grow.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Retaliation is related to nature and instinct, not to law. Law, by definition, cannot obey the same rules as nature.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Many foxes grow gray but few grow good.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Savages we call them because their manners differ from ours.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: There are dark shadows on the earth, but its lights are stronger in the contrast.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: What an ugly beast the ape, and how like us.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: I never wanted to weigh more heavily on a man than a bird.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: A mighty flame followeth a tiny spark.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: The game of golf would lose a great deal if croquet mallets and billiard cues were allowed on the putting green.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: The subtlety of nature is greater many times over than the subtlety of the senses and understanding.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Except during the nine months before he draws his first breath, no man manages his affairs as well as a tree does.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Animals are my friends... and I don't eat my friends.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: We long for an affection altogether ignorant of our faults. Heaven has accorded this to us in the uncritical canine attachment.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: It will never rain roses: when we want to have more roses we must plant more trees.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: In nature we never see anything isolated, but everything in connection with something else which is before it, beside it, under it and over it.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The unnatural, that too is natural.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: No exile at the South Pole or on the summit of Mont Blanc separates us more effectively from others than the practice of a hidden vice.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: Cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: It is just like man's vanity and impertinence to call an animal dumb because it is dumb to his dull perceptions.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: I want my food dead. Not sick, not dying, dead.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Sit down before fact as a little child, be prepared to give up every conceived notion, follow humbly wherever and whatever abysses nature leads, or you will learn nothing.
Author: Thomas Huxley

Quotes: It is the flash which appears, the thunderbolt will follow.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: No bird soars too high if he soars with his own wings.
Author: William Blake
